data.description:
7 KiB is a simple and power efficient watchface.

Inspired by Watch-Only Mode introduced in Firmware 3.9, this watchface was created by following (and adapting) the CloudPebble watchface tutorial.

The name comes from its size: 7 KiB = 6 KiB resources + 1 KiB binary.

I would like to thank Le Fauve for helping me out with the code.

latest_release.release_notes: Version compatible with all Pebbles running on Firmware 3.8 or newer.

data.title: 7 KiB

data.author: J2MC

changelog.release_notes: Initial Public Release

data.description:
Check out "Studio Health" for this watchface that uses Pebble Health integration!

The rings around the watch are linked to your steps, after 3 days of tracking one full ring will equal your average steps(and two full rings are double your average).  It will continue tracking your average to try and keep you moving more and more!

Screen only updates on minute change to be as battery friendly as possible.  Bluetooth disconnect notice built in(with vibration).
data.title: Studio FIT

changelog.release_notes: Improve the Pebble 2, squeezed HR into the top along with current step count.

Mainly bug fixes:

* Added the daily forecast high and low as colored ticks above the current temperature bar. Refreshed every 12 hours.

* Move the step count a few pixels up.

* Fixed vibrate on bt disconnect so it actually vibrates.

Fix 2nd timezone setting while using Clay
Use locally hosted app config (clay)
Make temps appears better when in C on square phones
Add configuration options for Fahrenheit, vibrate on disconnect and timezone
Add aplite support
Initial release

This is Black and White version DIGIGRADE for Classic Pebble and Pebble Time. (not support Round.)
This is a trial version that displays only the current time.(It's 8:29 PM)

Hour displays on the left side of the screen,Minute displays on the right side of the screen by Retrograde style.
Other days of the week, month, date, Battery level,Bluetooth status display are not working.
There are just still image.(Battery level is also still image of the 70% state.)

The second image is a paid version.
Please purchase the paid version with no function limit from website link.
https://gumroad.com/utdesign
Paid version's day of the week,month,date,battery level,Bluetooth status display are functioning.

All functions are the same as DIGIGRADE Color version.

data.author: Steve Cicco

changelog.release_notes:
New features for SDK 4.0 and Pebble 2!  Changes include:

- Support for Quick View notifications.  See the Triforce from the pause screen when notifications arrive.
- Although not quite as accurate as Pebble's Super Mario vibration, losing your Bluetooth connection now plays the first few notes from the Zelda theme

(Note: I only used emulator for Pebble 2 testing.  Hopefully there are no problems with the actual hardware)

- Moved configuration page to new site
- Added support for Pebble 2

- Chosen settings will be displayed on configuration page 
- 12/24 time setting removed and replaced with watch's setting
Bug where hearts didn't show on startup when activity level was 0

This release is only for Pebble Time and Pebble Time Round

- Flick your wrist to see the steps change to your daily goal
- Hearts are now an indicator of how close you are to active "Walking Link"
- Added a setting for how much activity is needed to get to "Walking Link"
- Bluetooth indicator is now a key
- Fixed bug with Celcius

- Added Aplite and Chalk versions
 - Increased activity level needed for "Walking Link"

data.description:
When he's not busy rescuing Zelda, everybody's favorite hero of Hyrule is here to "Link" you to your health!  Walk around for a little bit and Link changes to a walking pose.  Pass your daily average and he changes to "Touchdown Link".  The Triforce from the pause screen appears when a Quick View notification pops up.

Daily steps are shown in the top left indicated by "SX".  Flick your wrist to see the daily average indicated by "GX".

Temperature is below that and is indicated by "FX" for Fahrenheit and "CX" for Celsius.  

Battery level is below that and is indicated by "BX".

Your hearts will fill up as you become more active.  Full hearts give you walking Link.  The level of activity needed to fill the hearts is configurable.

A dungeon key indicates Bluetooth connection.  A short vibration playing the Zelda theme indicates the connection has been lost.

Temperature (C/F) and Time (12/24) are configurable.

**NOTE THE LATEST FIRMWARE (3.9) IS REQUIRED FOR ACCESSING HEALTH DATA**

latest_release.release_notes:
New features for SDK 4.0 and Pebble 2!  Changes include:

- Support for Quick View notifications.  See the Triforce from the pause screen when notifications arrive.
- Although not quite as accurate as Pebble's Super Mario vibration, losing your Bluetooth connection now plays the first few notes from the Zelda theme

(Note: I only used emulator for Pebble 2 testing.  Hopefully there are no problems with the actual hardware)

data.title: Health Link

data.author: Xander Dumaine

changelog.release_notes: Initial version

data.description:
The watchface shows the local time hour in large text, followed by the current date, followed by the UTC hour.

Minutes are represented by the arc around the outside. Every 5 minutes, the arc extends, with dots for each minute between.

When the battery is low (11-20%), the large hour text turns purplish and when it's very low (1-10%), the large hour text turns blue.

When the watch disconnects from bluetooth, it buzzes once, and the date turns blue.

latest_release.release_notes: Initial version

data.title: Polar UTC

data.description:
Watchface inspired by chops's Trekv3.

Features:
- Time (24H)
- Date (day of week & date)
- Day of year
- Week of year
- Weather information (temperature, conditions, icon, location (tap the pebble))
- Pebble battery status
- Phone battery status
- Network connection status
- Bluetooth connection status
- Health information (step count & distance)
- Customizable colors
- Customizable date style
- Customizable vibration options
- Sleep mode

Credits: see github page
Wishes: use pebble forum (website link)

data.description:
Hotpot

Put all your favorites into the pot.

Ingredients:
- Battery bar
- Date
- Time (12/24hr style, auto selection)
- Steps
- Temperature ('C or 'F)
- Humidity
- Weather icon
- Location
- Configurable background color
Show the hidden background (as the above first screenshot) by choosing the light yellow grid at the top right corner in the configuration page.

Notes:
The configuration page is using slate-config-example. 
So, the toggle of "High Contrast Mode" is used as a toggle of "Temperature Unit".

If "High Contrast Mode" is On, the temperature unit is Fahrenheit. 
If "High Contrast Mode" is Off, the temperature unit is Celsius.

Step source: Pebble Health. 
Weather source: OpenWeatherMap, GPS, update every 20 minutes. 
Fonts: Octin Spraypaint, Radicalblock and Gothic. 

Please Enjoy :-)

V1.6
- Quick fix for PTR.

V1.5
- Optimized UI 

V1.4
- Fixed weather icon in PTR

V1.3
- support PTR now
(verified in emulator only, and the weather icon seems disappear at bottom)

V1.2
- Support 12/24hr style, auto selection

V1.1 
- Optimized UI 
- Added Configuration Page (using slate-config-example, https://github.com/pebble-examples/slate-config-example.git) 
Note: 
If "High Contrast Mode" is On, the temperature unit is Fahrenheit. 
If "High Contrast Mode" is Off, the temperature unit is Celsius.

V1.0
- First Release.

latest_release.release_notes: - Quick fix for PTR.

data.author: Izaguirre

changelog.release_notes:
Added watchface icon.
New blue circle around text.

data.description:
The red circle represents the amount of steps you made the last 14 days, each segment of the circle represents one day.

If the segment is very thin, you made very few steps, if it's very wide, you made a lot of steps.

The segment of the circle at the right of the blue line represents the amount of steps you made today, the next segment is for yesterday, the next one, for the day before yesterday, and so on.

The yellow segments represent the Sundays.

This Watchface also shows the hours of sleep and the number of steps made today.

latest_release.release_notes:
Added watchface icon.
New blue circle around text.

changelog.release_notes: Added support for Pebble 2 and Quick Views

data.description:
Digital watchface, using numbers based on a diamond shape where the edge defines the time.  Read the hours from left to right and the minutes from top to bottom.
Displays in 12 or 24 hour mode, depending on watch settings.

Includes configuration option to change the edge color:
(1) Solar eclipse (yellow)
(2) Go Green (green)
(3) Bloodlet (red)
(4) Moon shine (white)

Check out the examples to make sure you know how to read all the digits.

Screenshots show:  
(1) 08:47
(2) 12:59
(3) 23:06 (24 hour mode)
(4) 09:28
(5) 23:20 (with Quick View)

This watchface design was created by Andrew Joy, from UK, and is published with his permission.

latest_release.release_notes: Added support for Pebble 2 and Quick Views

data.author: Luis Bento

changelog.release_notes: Added Binance to the Cryptocurrency market list
Timezones load properly on Shake/Tap/Sleep modes
Bug fixes
Fixed issues with classic Pebbles running out of memory
Fixed issues with iOS 8.4 not showing configs

Minor updates to configs
Optimized free memory for classic pebble devices

- Config now has a darker theme
- You can choose up to 2 timezones
- Choose up to 4 cryptocurrencies to check the price on the screen
Fixed issue where settings wouldn't load on Android
Cutting app size by half by removing support to Pebble Time 2 and optimizing configs even more.

- You can access configs offline now
- Fixed issue with weather not updating

This release prepares for 5.0 and fixes OpenWeatherMap
- Settings are stored in the app localStorage instead of the app's browser
- OpenWeatherMap now requires an API key since the timeboxed key was being blocked for hitting the rate limit.
Additional fix for OpenWeatherMap
Fixed OpenWeatherMap not updating

- Mute vibrations when on quiet mode
- Updating temperature unit now updates temperature right away
Changed OpenWeatherMap API Key

4.0 Release!
* Slots above and below hours now configurable
* More modules: Heart rate, compass and seconds
* Battery level and additional timezone are now modules too
* Support for Master key (pmkey.xyz)
* Shake or Tap to show additional modules
* More default color themes
* Support for Pebble Time 2
Fixed bug where watchface would crash if leading zero was disabled.

Added Active time module
Bluetooth disconnection only alerts once per disconnect (no more vibrating when coming back from an app while still disconnected)
Added Pebble 2 (diorite) support

Added Leco and Konstruct Fonts
Added Sunrise and sunset modules
Added support for Timeline quickview events (Pebble Time only)
Added more date formats and date separator option

data.description:
Simple and clean fully customizable watchface with weather, health data and additional timezone.

Key features:

* Customize the watchface by choosing what modules to show and where.
* Customize colors (you can choose between just text/background colors or change colors for every item)
* Save and load color presets
* Choose between 8 different fonts (Blocko, Blocko large, Pebble fonts, Archivo Narrow, OSP-DIN, Prototype, Leco and Konstruct W00)
* Choose text alignment
* Weather modules with current weather and temperature, wind speed and direction, with low and high for the day too.
* Sunrise and sunset times
* Choose between OpenWeatherMap, Weather Underground, Forecast.io and Yahoo Weather for weather data
* Health modules with steps, distance walked, active time, heart rate (w/ smartstrap) and calorie count.
* Display different modules for half an hour after you wake up.
* Display health data in a different color if you're falling behind your monthly average for that day of the week.
* Display additional timezones
* NEW * Display cryptocurrency prices
* Bluetooth disconnect icon and vibration alert
* See in the watch when there's an update available
* Support for 14 languages (English, Portuguese, French, German, Spanish, Italian, Dutch, Danish, Turkish, Czech, Polish, Swedish, Finnish and Slovak)
* Choice between various date formats.
* Support for Timeline Quickview events.
* Supports Master Key (pmkey.xyz).
* Tap or Shake to show additional modules.

latest_release.release_notes: Added Binance to the Cryptocurrency market list

data.title: Timeboxed

data.description:
Prepare for takeoff with SkyMaster
A weather-centric analog GMT watchface with Pebble Health step count.
Battery level indicator between the 12 and 2 position (ie 9min past the hour is 90%, 3min is 30%). GMT/24hr indicator (red triangle) which can be adjusted to any timezone in settings (time indicated on a 24 hour scale, not 12 hours). Current temp, day and date always on. Quick wrist shake to show second hand and full weather info. Another shake hides second hand and weather or will auto hide after 2 minutes. Weather info includes; 
-current conditions
-daily forecast (temp range and conditions)
-Sun rise and set times
-Wind speed and chill
-% humidity 
-Current air pressure + rise/fall/steady
-Moon phase
OPTIONS:
-Light or dark color scheme
-Vibe on BT disconnect
NEW: GMT hand automatically adjust to local daylight savings time using the TimezoneDB.com API

latest_release.release_notes: Support for OAuth on Yahoo weather

Simple watch face with vertical hour and minutes.

Customize minutes colour and ability to remove leading zero in the settings.
data.title: Verticalface

data.author: Zach Burnham

changelog.release_notes: Releasing some changes that have been on my own wrist for quite a while now :)
Fixed daily color change feature.
Adding features! Language support! Inverted colors and bluetooth vibrate on disconnect/connect are some of the new options.
Adding features! Language support! Inverted colors and bluetooth vibrate on disconnect/connect are some of the new options.
Added inverted color option for black on white background. Added options to be unlocked if people donate.
Fixed loading of past data.
Fixing the weather for real.
Fix weather option.
Fixed a problem with weather fetching.
Updated with options for bold text or dots and an option to show an experimental weather dot. Location is not used unless you ask for weather.
Adding sleep time shown in place of step count in the morning. If you want it to go away and show step count instead, go for a run :)
Added some more color options and fixed some things you probably won't notice... but I do.
Added options to show date, show step count, and add some color.
Added history and tweaked the activity algorithm. Upon opening the watchface, past activity will be loaded, but the past 15 minutes worth of data may not be available, so it cannot be displayed.

Fixed important issue with proper display of activity over long period of watchface use. 

The previous hour's activity now sticks around as dimmed. It looks so good.
Initial release. Enjoy!

data.description:
This watchface uses Pebble Health data to show the time along with a visual display of how active you are every minute of the hour. It is inspired by a Fitbit watchface.

Includes the following options: 
  - show date 
  - show step count / sleep time (If selected, sleep time will show only when you want it to. Trust me.)
  - color schemes
  - show weather dot (Uses location - location is not used unless this is selected. Dot is shown at the minute mark that corresponds to current temperature.)

latest_release.release_notes: Releasing some changes that have been on my own wrist for quite a while now :)

data.title: Active Hour

data.author: Jake Varness

changelog.release_notes: First Release of Arrowhead watchface by Jake Varness.

data.description:
A very simple and minimalistic watchface that uses a triangle to display what hour of the day it is, and an arrow to display the minutes.

The center of the watchface is bordered using the same color as the minute hand, and functions as a battery indicator, displaying light blue for a battery above 50%, yellow for below 50%, and red for below 20%.

latest_release.release_notes: First Release of Arrowhead watchface by Jake Varness.

data.title: Arrowhead

data.author: Adam Eisenstein

changelog.release_notes:
New features (turn on in settings):
Vibrate when reaching step goal
Centered battery bar option

Bug fixes:
More accurate weather fetch times! (old formula would only fetch once per hour if set between 30 and 60 mins)
No longer overflows step count when going over 20,000 steps (example: 25600 -> 2.56K)
Fixed the "Loading..." bug when returning to watch face (finally!)
Slight fix for the new step goal feature

Added a couple features I've been working on:

Step Goals! 
Just use the slider to select a step goal between 0 and 20,000. When you hit your goal, the step count will turn a color of your choice (working on adding an optional vibration, too). Not a feature you want? Totally fine! Just leave the slider at 0 (the default) and it'll be just like always.

Weather Update Frequency!
Want to save battery? Fetching weather frequently can decrease it quickly, so I've added a slider to adjust how frequently it updates the weather, between once every 5 minutes and once per hour.

Big update! Hope you like it!
Added a much-requested feature, COLOR CUSTOMIZATION! Yes, now you can change both the background AND text colors! The future is now!
More options! The battery bar can now be either colorful (classic), or solid (black or white, depending on your screen color). Love a green background? Make the battery bar visible by switching it to solid mode!
In the same vein, you can now choose either a black or white Bluetooth Disconnect icon!
24 hour time and Celsius continue to work. I'll be adding more in the coming weeks so stay tuned! Have a feature request? Send me an email using "contact developer" on the app page.
Thanks for using Simple Time!
Celsius conversion fix
Yellow battery bar when at 50% and a fix for weather conditions sometimes appearing over the battery bar
Date fix for Pebble Time
Added a Bluetooth disconnect icon (no vibration on disconnect to save battery)
Fixed Pebble Round date bug
Fixed Fahrenheit computation

Added Customizations - 24h time and Celsius options; Added gradient of colors from green to red for the battery bar; Added curved battery bar for Pebble Time Round; Original Pebble - added larger date line, solid black battery bar, removed "Loading" if no internet connection; Fixed a bug where 24h time would sometimes show question marks; Bug fixes and under-the-hood improvements
Removed customization, added image
Added Step Counter and colors for battery bar.

data.description:
A simple watch face that displays time, date, weather, battery, and step count. 

Now available: So much customization!
Background color!
Font color!
Battery bar color! (choose between colorful or black/white)
Bluetooth disconnect icon color!
24 Hour Time!
Celsius!
Step Goals!
Weather from OpenWeather, you can change how frequently it updates!

Battery bar: 
100-70% = Bright Green
70%-50% = Green
50% = Yellow
50%-20% = Dark Red
20%-0% = Bright Red

Featuring an A-grade battery rating.

Coming soon: D/M/Y format option, shake for more, and more. Have a feature request? Let me know!

latest_release.release_notes:
New features (turn on in settings):
Vibrate when reaching step goal
Centered battery bar option

Bug fixes:
More accurate weather fetch times! (old formula would only fetch once per hour if set between 30 and 60 mins)
No longer overflows step count when going over 20,000 steps (example: 25600 -> 2.56K)
Fixed the "Loading..." bug when returning to watch face (finally!)

data.title: Simple Time

data.author: centuryglass

changelog.release_notes: Added: themes, Pebble Health step count support, better time and date format options.
Fixed problems with initial connection to the companion app.

data.description:
EventPercent watchface shows you what percent of your calendar event has already passed, or how long you have until future events start.  Events are automatically fetched from calendars on your Android phone.  

Weather, phone and Pebble battery percentage, and additional information are also displayed.  Information text at the top can display weather info, last detected location, unread SMS, or number of pages saved to Pocket.  Configuration options include calendar selection, color configuration, date and time formats, and more.

latest_release.release_notes: Added: themes, Pebble Health step count support, better time and date format options.

data.title: EventPercent

data.description:
Keep Pace is a simple watchface that displays your daily steps! The battery level is also displayed, right on the edge of the screen! When Pebble is disconnected, a disabled bluetooth icon will pop and the watch will vibrate once.

Attention: The daily steps update only once every minute in order to prolong battery life!

Features:
- All Pebbles are supported!
- Daily Steps
- Battery Level
- Date
- Bluetooth connection status

Pebble 3.9 brought the Pebble Health API. You know what that means... Health statistics right on your favorite watchface!

Thanks to @Freepik for the jogging stick man and @Google for the bluetooth icon, from Flaticon.

Don't forget to share the !

latest_release.release_notes:
v1.2
- Tiny update to make the vibration stronger

data.title: Keep Pace

data.author: Lignite

changelog.release_notes: Fixed another bug with logging in

Added support for Pebble 2
Fixed date format not sending on black and white watches (sorry!)
Fixed crash in setting some settings
Fixed settings not loading sometimes
-Fixed some trial issues
-Improved look and feel of some health modules
-Fixed some users not being able to purchase settings or interact with their Lignite account

-Added custom date format builder
-Added new bluetooth alerts - much faster and more lightweight
-Added two new outer circle types: analogue ticks and analogue circles
-Added outer circle background colour 
-Added active calories burned
-Added resting calories burned
-Added options to disable minute and hour analogues
-Fixed celsius not working
-Fixed weather not updating when you changed the temperature setting
-Fixed weather settings not saving with live settings
-Fixed crash on saving some settings
-Fixed crash on load for some users
-Fixed settings not saving
-Re-enable live settings (it's now using a Lignite server)

Watchface changes:
-Added live settings! Change any setting you'd like without having to hit the "Save Changes" button
-Fixed a crash when saving settings
-Fixed crash when you had weather enabled on top or bottom slot but not the time
-Fixed settings not saving for some users

Server side changes:
-Fixed analogue hands not disappearing
-Fixed bluetooth alerts not changing
-Fixed some toggles being broken
-Fixed watchface not loading at all, I think

-Fixed weather not displaying on temperatures below -10
-Fixed settings screen being broken for some users

-Fixed weather icon turning into a "P" or "O" after a length of time
-Fixed "The Spooky Effect"
-Fixed some users not being able to login

-Fixed settings not properly saving (I hope for real this time!)
-Fixed trial reappearing for some more users
-Small speed improvements

We hope you're loving Modulite. Here are a few more things to love it for:
-Added battery module
-Added bluetooth module
-Added "shake to hide analogue arms" setting
-Added seconds analogue arm setting
-Added imperial measurements setting
-Added battery circle setting
-Fixed date formatting issues on the bottom
-Fixed weather not loading for some users
-Fixed icons slowly loading
-Fixed trial window reappearing (please email us ASAP if you still have this issue)
-Fixed crash with a certain combo of modules
-Quicker loading times
-Improved design

Fixes this release! More features being added in 1.2 :) 

-Fixed errors within settings page for "multiple accounts" 
-Fixed trial being stuck in some cases 
-Fixed time slot at the top being improperly rendered (thanks Shosh!) 
-Fixed weather being spaced out too far and improved weather font (thanks again!) 
-Improved closing speed of watchface 
-Some other small spacing improvements
Initial release. Enjoy!

data.description:
Modulite in one word: modular.

Customize Modulite the way YOU want it, inserting different elements, such as health, weather, battery and more. You can also customize every colour on the screen.

---

This is a paid watchface. You will get the first 24 hours free.

latest_release.release_notes: Fixed another bug with logging in

data.title: Modulite

data.author: George Hilliard

changelog.release_notes: - Actually fix Calorie display (the previous release had a typo in the code and always showed 0 kiloCalories).
- Fixed display problems with calories in the Health complication

- Migrated to SDK 4.0: you must be running Pebble OS 4.0, except classic Pebble users
- Added support for Pebble 2
- Added support for Quick View popups
- Tweaked the rendering of small distances in the Health complication (now a zero is placed in front of the decimal)
- Improved rendering on black-and-white watches

- Fixed an issue where hands would not animate when very close to the 12:00 position.
- Corrected a couple of internal code-correctness issues.
- Fixed poorly-aligned disconnection and low battery icons

- Animations can now be disabled in settings.
- There is a new low- and charging-battery indicator; this only displays if there are no battery complications.
- Made minor improvements to several animations.

- Added gadget for date and health complications!  For health, choose from many different metrics like calories burned and distance walked.  For date, choose to display the day of the week or the month of the year.
- Added units for weather and health complications.
- Fixed several small animation bugs.
- Removed legacy migration code that analytics say nobody should be using anymore.

- Now uses new Health API to display your by-minute average as a dot
- Added an explanation of the weather complication to the configuration page

- Added a new timezone complication!  Choose its time zone in the settings page.  Note that daylight savings time changes are not applied to the complication
- Improved battery usage of health complication
- Slightly reduced watchface program size

This is the first release for Aplite! Three new themes have been added, including two with white backgrounds. Also improved battery usage and animation smoothness.

Now built with the release SDK; sorry for any issues you may have run into!
Fixed an issue where the watch would not vibrate on Bluetooth reconnect.  Unfortunately, you will have to re-save your settings to completely fix the issue; sorry for the inconvenience!
Fixed an issue where the no-connection icon would not appear when enabled.
Fixed an issue where the manual goal would be ignored after relaunching the app.
Fixed an issue that could occur when trying to get the weather for the very first time.
Lots of new features, including a new brighter default theme! Other new features include: manual weather location, manual health goal, vibrate on connect, and quiet while sleeping.
It is now possible to choose what is displayed in the weather complication! You can choose from current conditions, temperature, or relative humidity.
Fixed an issue where the backlight would illuminate on shake, even if disabled in System Settings.
This is the first public release!  Let me know if you find bugs or have ideas for features.

data.description:
Consensus is an elegant, informative watchface that displays information from a variety of sources.  You can aggregate information into your choice of complications that display behind the main face.  You can also choose from several themes, pictured above.

You can choose from the following complications.  More are in development!

- Battery charge level
- Current weather (temperature in red and humidity in blue)
- Current date
- Extra timezone
- Health data (today's steps vs. your average)
- None (disable the complication)

You can also configure the face to vibrate upon disconnection or at the top of each hour, and you can choose what is displayed in the weather complication -- current conditions, temperature, or humidity.  There's also a custom step goal, quiet time, and more!

Shoot me an email if you have an idea for a new complication or other feature!

Weather is provided by OpenWeatherMap.
Weather icons are provided by Pebble.
Banner background is CC BY-SA from subtlepatterns.com.

latest_release.release_notes: - Actually fix Calorie display (the previous release had a typo in the code and always showed 0 kiloCalories).

data.title: Consensus

data.description:
Displays a graph of your activity steps against a 24-hour clock. Track your daily activity, and compare it against yesterday's. Use the custom Settings button for different options, including setting your step goal.

The sunrise and sunset times are where the top and bottom colors change.

Tap the watch to display weather information.

There are customizable settings for your daily goal, temperature scale, screen colors, and more.

Pebble Health is required, so the daily steps are only available on Pebble Time smart watches. Pebble Classic users can still reference the 24-hour clock, current weather temperature, and sunrise/sunset information.

latest_release.release_notes: 2.4 Firmware 4.0 icons

data.title: Daily Steps

data.title: Poke-a-Minute

data.author: HBTeicher
data.description:
As a watch, the Pebble Smartwatch is unique for many reasons - including its ability to present time in a completely new way. As a non-numeric person, I find it incredibly intuitive to read time as natural language - give it a try today!
 
- Natural language time in English. 
- Accelerometer flick alternates current date, week number and precise current time in 24H format or simple time screen.
- Battery indicator bar at bottom of screen.
- Inverts and vibrates on loss of BlueTooth connection.
data.title: Natural Language Time

data.author: DC

changelog.release_notes: Corrected glitch that prevented color of sunset indicator from being set independently of sunrise indicator.  Also changed color of analog time indicator on "inverted" color scheme (white background) from "Limerick" to "Chrome Yellow", for additional contrast.
Added support for new config option to disable location updates.  (Redditor's mentioned hourly checks could wake GPS from slumber, depleting phone's battery for some users.)
initial release

data.description:
Elegant, simple, and practical, this is a variant of the original "Sliding Time" text watch with some significant enhancements for the Pebble Time Round. Most notably, the text is always centered vertically, and a subtle analog feature is incorporated around the perimeter, with indications for local sunrise & sunset. With just a glance at these dots you can judge how much time is left in the day.

Complete list of enhancements:
*  Rather than "Twelve O'clock", it will say "Twelve Noon" or "Twelve Midnight".
*  The time display will always be centered vertically, whether it is 2 lines or 3 lines.  The transition is animated.
*  Single digit times can be prefixed with O' (same line), "Oh" (extra line), or neither, at the user's option.
*  The day of the week is fully spelled out and shown in a large font, with proper capitalization.
*  The month is abbreviated for space concerns at the bottom. The proper ordinal is used (e.g. "1st" rather than "1"). 
*  User can quickly switch between five color schemes (default, inverted, and three customizable schemes).
*  A subtle analog clock feature is incorporated. A semicircle transverses the perimeter of the screen once a day, with midnight on the bottom and noon on top.
*  Two dots along the perimeter identify the sunrise and sunset times. These are computed on the watch, not looked up from a service. To do this, it must determine location from phone's GPS; dots will not appear until this has completed successfully at least once. (Attempts made once a minute until first success, with updates requested each hour, unless disabled.)

latest_release.release_notes: Corrected glitch that prevented color of sunset indicator from being set independently of sunrise indicator.  Also changed color of analog time indicator on "inverted" color scheme (white background) from "Limerick" to "Chrome Yellow", for additional contrast.

data.title: Text Watch Deluxe

data.author: UTDESIGN
data.description:
This is a Trial version that displays only the current time.(It's 9:02 PM) Ver.1.1 updated.
This is the watchface that displays the time in Digital and Analogue (retrograde style).
Hour displays on the left side of the screen,Minute displays on the right side of the screen by Retrograde style.
Other days of the week, month, date, Battery level,Bluetooth status display are not working.
There are just still image.(Battery level is also still image of the 70% state.)

The second image is a Paid version.
Please purchase the paid version with no function limit from website link.
https://gumroad.com/utdesign
Paid version's day of the week,month,date,battery level,Bluetooth status display are functioning.
data.title: DIGIGRADE Trial

data.author: GrakovNe

changelog.release_notes:
What's new?
 - Updated font (russian and german symbols)
 - Improved appearance
 - Groups in the settings
 - Blinking time colon (as option)
 - Reduced battery using
 - Optimized code and resource, reduced size

What's new?

 * Animated battery icon when watch is charging
 * "Never" to AI refresh period
 * Updated font and german language
 * Updated non-refreshed-data icon
 * Fixed default weather provider
 * Fixed battery drain 
 * Fixed bug with non-refreshed-data icon
 * Fixed settings page on Apple devices

Whats' new:
 * Updated icon
 * Fixed font

What's new:
 * Added german language
 * Now you can swap date and weekday
 * Watch can show time of last disconnect
 * Reduced battery drain (up to 30%)
 * Added lot of AdditionalInfo: exchange rates, stock exchanges, sunrise and sunset, etc...
 * Added US date format
First version

data.description:
New version of stylish, smart and customizable smartface for Pebble!

Now, SmartFace fully optimized for Pebble TimeLine and works on Pebble Classic, Steel or Time perfectly!

features:
- Display date, time, weather, text string, BT and battery state

- Vibrate every hour, when BT connection lost and when charging

- Wide opportunities for customization: you can off almost every interface unit

- It looks stylish and simple

- Low battery drain because the application is perfectly optimized

- In additional string you may set lot of a useful information

latest_release.release_notes:
What's new?
 - Updated font (russian and german symbols)
 - Improved appearance
 - Groups in the settings
 - Blinking time colon (as option)
 - Reduced battery using
 - Optimized code and resource, reduced size
